intro: Gilia inconspicua subsp. euinconspicua, commonly known as the inconspicuous gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its slender stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and flower structure compared to other subspecies of Gilia inconspicua.
